title: Supervision in Drilling Operations
content: Front-line supervisors (tool pushers, drillers, barge engineers) are the link between planning and execution. Supervisors allocate work, monitor compliance, manage contractors, and provide leadership. Supervisor competence includes technical skills and non-technical skills: leadership, communication, and performance management. Effective supervision is a critical control for MAH.

scenario.story: A supervisor observes a crew member skipping a step in a safety-critical procedure to save time. The task completes successfully. What should the supervisor do?

options.B: Correct the behavior and investigate why the step was skipped
options.D: Counsel the crew member privately after the shift

scenario.explanation: Successful outcome doesn't justify procedural deviation. Investigate why: was it time pressure, poor procedure design, lack of understanding, or normalization of deviance? Address the root cause, not just the behavior.

openQuestions: What competency standards exist for supervisors on your rig?
How do supervisors balance production pressure against safety-critical compliance?
